ai.summary: Combe Valley Greenway is a 9.3 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom along a former rail corridor. The route offers flat to gently undulating terrain, accessible for most walkers, and peaceful countryside scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently rolling terrain on a former railway line. Surfaces are typically surfaced paths (tarmac or compacted gravel) with some softer verges. Expect well-marked paths, occasional shaded sections, and occasional crossings of minor routes.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go; surfaces can be slippery when wet. Be mindful of other path users, especially cyclists on shared sections. Carry enough water and snacks, wear sturdy footwear, and bring a map or offline GPS. If hiking after dark, have a light and let someone know your plan.
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (March–October) are typically ideal; the trail can be hiked year-round with appropriate clothing.

seo.title: Combe Valley Greenway Hike – 9.3 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 9.3 km Combe Valley Greenway in the United Kingdom. A moderate, family-friendly hike along a former railway line with practical tips, gear, and best seasons.
